reference.title: Important Details and Warnings for Soldering
reference.shortdesc: When soldering wires to the pot casings, there is a risk of frying the carbon track, which will either break the pot entirely or limit its ability to control volume or tone.

section.title: Steps to Reduce Risk of Heat Damage

ul.li: Ensure your soldering iron is heated to at least 360 degrees Celsius. The hotter it is, the less time it needs to be in contact with the pot casing.
After soldering a wire to the pot casing, give it some time to cool before soldering anything else to it.
While not required, using heat sinks can help limit the amount of heat transfered to the pots.
